application.doc: Retrieving a summary of Reverse Proxy health

method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieving a summary of Reverse Proxy health
method.doc: To retrieve a summary of the health of all configured Reverse Proxy instance using the web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the resource URI.
The health states are represented as an integer. Their valid states include: 0 Healthy, 1 Unhealthy, 2 Warning

An item is considered Healthy or Unhealthy if all children Junctions and Servers are Healthy or Unhealthy. A warning is returned for items which contain a mixture of Healthy and Unhealthy Junction/Servers.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: items
param.doc: The nodes containing the Reverse Proxy instances and their health.

param.name: label
param.doc: The name of the element containing the human readable label for each node.

param.name: identifier
param.doc: The name of the element containing the unique identifier for each node.

param.name: name
param.doc: The Reverse Proxy Instance name. (Can be used as a unique identifier)

param.name: health
param.doc: The overall health for this Reverse Proxy instance.

param.name: children
param.doc: Nodes containing information about the junctions configured on this Reverse Proxy instance.

param.name: name
param.doc: The Reverse Proxy Instance name and junction label. (Can be used as a unique identifier)

param.name: health
param.doc: The overall health for this Reverse Proxy junction.

param.name: children
param.doc: Nodes containing information about the back-end servers for this junction.

param.name: name
param.doc: The Reverse Proxy Instance name, junction label, server IP/hostname and port. (Can be used as a unique identifier)

param.name: label
param.doc: The back-end server hostname/IP address and port.

param.name: health
param.doc: The health of this back-end server.
